title: (x) "Beyond Swiss Tradition" Zurich Jazz Orchestra - Arbiter BQ {Claes Kallarsson}
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080314020407im_/http:/typophile.com/files/zjo_1_5b.jpg)

 [‹ Slate magazine logotype](http://web.archive.org/web/20080314020407/http:/typophile.com/node/19422 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Great Lengths swash capitals - Arabella {Mike Y} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080314020407/http:/typophile.com/node/19409 "Go to next forum topic")
author: fluxism

comments.content: My guess is something custom. It’s Carousel with Walbaum serifs. Or Didot with ball terminals. It’s lovely. And what about those wiggidywack ’s’s?
i agree. what a lovely-looking typeface.
Fluxism, do you know who did it?
haha, I was going to name this “walbaumy carousel” but thought it would look like nonsense

it’s from this portfolio site:

[http://www.mikati.net/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080314020407/http:/www.mikati.net/ "http://www.mikati.net/")

somebody on newstoday already emailed her, I believe
This is pretty. Someone needs to start a [Ball Terminals](http://web.archive.org/web/20080314020407/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Ball%252BTerminals) wiki entry.

Very niiice find, Claes.  
_Even designed by Aldo Novarese. :)_

Dav

Nice find!

It reminded me of the slightly more stylish cousin of Fenice. :^P
Designed by Aldo Novarese. Beautiful font!
I don’t think the digital version does it any justice though.

<cite>I don’t think the digital version does it any justice though.</cite>

but if it was designed in 1989, shouldn’t that mean it’s always been digital?
what do you think of the lighter weights?
